meanings.definition: The coldest season of the year, occurring between autumn and spring.
meanings.sent1: In wintertimes, the snow covers everything in a white blanket.
meanings.sent2: I love to drink hot cocoa by the fireplace during wintertimes.
meanings.sent3: During wintertimes, the squirrels wear tiny scarves to keep warm.
meanings.sent4: The silence of wintertimes is like a peaceful lullaby to the earth.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of wintertimes is both harsh and breathtaking.

meanings.definition: During or characteristic of the winter season.
meanings.sent1: The wintertimes wind was bitterly cold against my face.
meanings.sent2: Her wintertimes coat was thick and cozy, perfect for the snow.
meanings.sent3: The wintertimes sun peeked through the clouds, offering a brief warmth.
meanings.sent4: His wintertimes smile was as bright as the snow reflecting the sun.
meanings.sent5: The wintertimes nights were long but filled with twinkling stars.

meanings.definition: The period of time when winter weather occurs.
meanings.sent1: During the wintertimes, we have to shovel the driveway every morning.
meanings.sent2: Wintertimes can be challenging, but also magical with the right mindset.
meanings.sent3: In wintertimes, the hot chocolate consumption in our house triples.
meanings.sent4: The wintertimes seem to slow down the world, inviting introspection.
meanings.sent5: The wintertimes bring a sense of unity as we all face the cold together.
